description:
The LA Clippers are looking to hire a Manager of VIP services provide best in class VIP experience in our brand new, technology driven arena, Intuit Dome! In this role you will help coordinate event services for our VIP and Executive teams. This is a great opportunity to create a VIP hospitality experience for Ownership, Executives, and other VIP guests including agents, artists and celebrities.

This is a full-time role based in Inglewood, CA and is eligible for our competitive benefit offering including medical, dental, vision, 401(k) plan with company contribution, Well-Being Allowance, and more. Due to the nature of this industry, the candidate must be available to work a flexible schedule including weeknights, weekends, and holidays to cover high profile concerts and NBA games.

What You Will Do

  • Communicate event details to guests to ensure seamless arrival and entry, including planning site visits and Intuit Dome App education
  • Partner closely with and develop strong relationships with external partners and internal teams like artist/touring crews, local law enforcement, building operations, security officers, arena hosts, and concessionaire to provide excellent VIP experience
  • Partner with external and internal parties on event/project needs to ensure successful planning, logistics, budget, and execution
  • Collaborate on procurement and planning of gifting and inventory, including orders and fulfillment
  • Assist with internal and external ticketing processing and distribution.
  • Prepare internal VIP Event Manifest of guest details, ticket allocations, and amenities (parking, club access, etc.)
  • Manage VIP database of guest profiles and preferences
  • Reconcile hard costs, budgets, and expense reports
  • Track and design invitations and event collateral including signage, registration forms, and confirmation letters
  • Generate event summaries, recaps, and track feedback and progress memos
  • Organize and maintain internal event equipment and evergreen materials
  • Explore gifting bids & assess competition to ensure highest quality of services & products and fiscal responsibility
  • Work with VIP and Event Services Associate and event day staff to coordinate VIP experiences, including welcoming & escorting guests from their arrival to departure, preparing guest amenities (gifting, special occasion/celebration), and monitoring club environments
  • Assist in maintaining department calendar


Your Background, Skills And Qualifications

  • 3-5 years’ experience in VIP events or hospitality
  • Extremely detail-oriented with an eye for event presentation
  • Comfortability interacting with executives of all levels and well-known personalities
  • Extremely detail-oriented with an eye for event and gift presentation
  • Ability to multi-task and think quickly in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a positive and professional demeanor
  • Resourceful and strategic approach regarding planning, budget, and sustainability
  • Organized self-starter and task-oriented with excellent time management
  • Flexibility to travel for special project and event needs
  • Meet the physical demands of event setup, breakdown, lifting, loading, and unloading of materials
  • Available to work nontraditional hours including late nights, weekends, and holidays to support exciting events and games at Intuit Dome
  • Experience with Photoshop and Microsoft Office is a plus
  • Ability to learn, contribute and thrive in a fast-growing, dynamic environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate and positively interact in a diverse multi-cultural environment.


About Intuit Dome:

Opening in August 2024, Intuit Dome is the new home of the LA Clippers and will host hundreds of sporting events and concerts each year. Located in Inglewood, Calif., Intuit Dome is built different -- it will redefine fans’ expectations for live experiences and change the music landscape in Los Angeles.

Set to host the 2026 NBA All-Star game, Intuit Dome is over 1 million square feet and features our team training center, business operations offices, five full-sized basketball courts, an 80,000 square foot outdoor plaza and a double-sided Halo Board composed of more than an acre of LED.

Compensation

  • The range for this position is $68,000 - $85,000 annual compensation. Compensation package offered will be based on multiple individualized factors, including a candidate's job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
  • The role is classified as exempt.


Benefits And Perks

We offer a competitive benefits program, including:

  • Medical, Dental and Vision plans
  • 401(k) plan with company contribution
  • Wellbeing Allowance of up to $1,000 per year
  • Financial Education and Wellness Program, including access to Certified Financial Planners
  • Paid vacation and sick time
  • Paid parental leave
  • Flexible Spending Accounts (Medical and Dependent Care)
  • Company-paid Long Term Disability insurance
  • Company-paid Life and AD&D Insurance
  • Voluntary Life Insurance options for employee, spouse and children
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Mind health support via Modern Health and Headspace


The LA Clippers are a proud equal opportunity employer. It is our desire and intent that all employees enjoy a professional business working environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

To view our employment privacy policy, please visit https://www.nba.com/clippers/california-employment-privacy-policy
